alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following county, Big Horn. * WHEN...Until 645 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry coulees. Overflowing poor drainage areas forcing water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Rainfall is ongoing and may continue for another hour or two. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tullock Creek, South Fork Cottonwood Creek, Cottonwood Creek, Big Meadow Creek, Plum Creek, Dry Creek, Little Dry Creek, Willow Creek, Custer Creek, Dawes Creek, East Cabin Creek and North Fork Reno Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crow Indian Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
